Dear Mack McGhee:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Program statement
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/19/24 a staff member had an inappropriate conversation of
sexual content with three male youths.
Investigation Interviews
Complainant was interviewed on 12/02/2024. Complainant does
not have additional information.
Youth A was interviewed on 11/27/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with DHHS worker 1. Youth A stated he was
talking with Youth B, Youth C and Youth D on 11/19/2024 about
becoming a father soon because Youth B and Youth C already
have a child. Youth A stated Staff 1 joined their conversation and
started talking about unprotected sex. Youth A stated Staff 1 said,
“semen doesn’t fall out, sticks to the walls” in explaining how
females get pregnant. Youth A stated Staff 1 then shared she
went on a date with a man, who offered to “eat her out” while she
was on her menses. Youth A stated no one knew what to say.
Staff 1’s story and the conversation ended. Youth A stated this
was the only inappropriate conversation he had with Staff 1. Youth
A stated Staff 2 was nearby and overheard Staff 1’s story.
Youth B was interviewed on 11/27/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with DHHS worker 1. Youth B stated he and
Youth A, Youth C and Youth D were talking on 11/19/2024 about
having children. Youth B stated Staff 1 joined their conversation
and told them not to have unprotected sex. Youth B stated Staff 1
explained that females get pregnant when “semen sticks to their
walls”. Youth B stated Staff 1 asked them if they wanted to hear
the “nastiest thing” and asked that the story stay “in the circle”
(private). Youth B stated Staff 1 shared that she once lied about
being on her menses to her date. Her date responded that he
2

would perform oral sex if she wore a tampon. Youth B stated their
conversation ended after the story because it was “too weird”.
Youth B stated Staff 1 never shared other inappropriate stories.
Youth B stated Staff 2 overheard the story because she said “ain’t
trying to hear that”.
Youth C was interviewed on 11/27/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with DHHS worker 1. Youth C stated he and
Youth A, Youth B and Youth D were in Unit 2D’s common area
talking about being fathers when Staff 1 joined their conversation.
Youth C stated Staff 1 told them never to have unprotected sex
because they were not ready to have children and explained that
females get pregnant when “semen sticks in a girl’s walls”. Youth
C stated Staff 1 questioned out loud if she should share a story
and then told them about a man who tried to “eat her out” while
she was on her menses wearing a tampon. Youth C stated he and
Youth A, Youth B and Youth D looked at each other, did not
respond and walked away. Youth C stated this is the only sexual
conversation he had with Staff 1. Youth C stated Staff 2 overheard
their conversation with Staff 1 and did not respond.
Youth D was interviewed on 12/05/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with DHHS worker 2. Youth D stated Staff 1
provided sex education by telling him, Youth A, Youth B and
Youth C that a female gets pregnant when “semen gets stuck”.
Youth D stated Staff 1 started to tell them something but stopped
when she was not sure if it was a “safe space.” Youth D stated
either Youth A, Youth B or Youth C asked Staff 1 to continue with
her story. Youth D stated Staff 1 shared that a man wanted to “eat
her out” while she was on her menses wearing a tampon. Youth D
stated this was the only inappropriate story Staff 1 has shared.
Youth D stated Staff 2 was on the unit talking to another youth
when Staff 1 shared this story and did not hear their conversation.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 12/05/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with DHHS worker 2. Staff 1 stated she talked with
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C and Youth D about becoming a parent
and having boundaries in relationships. Staff 1 stated she wanted
to be “informative” and thought twice before sharing a personal
experience. Staff 1 stated she told the youths that years ago she
went on a date and returned to her date’s home. She lied to her
date that she was on her menses because she did not want
sexual contact with him. Her date asked, “Do you have a tampon
in? Still give you head if you do.” Staff 1 stated she thought this
story was a “teachable moment” to help the youths understand
respecting boundaries and not focusing on their wants. Staff 1
3

stated looking back she realizes that her story was not appropriate
to share with the youths.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 12/05/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with DHHS worker 2. Staff 2 stated she did not overhear
an inappropriate conversation between Staff 1 and Youth A, Youth
B, Youth C and Youth D on 11/19/2024 on Unit 2D. Staff 2 stated
she overheard Staff 1 and these youths talk about the cost of
formula and general costs in having children since and Youth A
will soon be a father and Youth B already is a father.
Manager stated on 12/05/2024 that Staff 1 is a part-time
employee with no discipline history.
Documentation
Wayne County Juvenile Detention’s Code of Ethics policy and
procedure 3.1 states “Staff Members [sic] shall not interact or
have contact with present or former youths on a personal level.
Staff shall not share personal information with youth. Staff shall
not take pictures or videos of youth.”
Analysis The agency is found in violation because Staff 1 admits to sharing
an inappropriate personal story with the youths.
CONSULTATION
It is suggested the agency develop a sex education curriculum.
and a life skills group for young fathers.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

Rule Code Grievance procedures.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4132
Section (2) The procedure shall provide for all of the following:
Description (a) Safeguarding the legal rights of residents and their
families.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Additional finding
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed on 11/27/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with DHHS worker 1. Youth A stated he saw
the unit merit sheet on the staff desk and saw that Staff 1 did not
give him merit points on 11/19/2024 for using profanity. Youth A
stated he wrote a grievance because Staff 1 should not be able to
share her dating story without repercussion if he cannot use
profanity. Youth A stated Staff 2 knew he wrote a grievance on
Staff 1.
Youth B was interviewed on 11/27/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with DHHS worker 1. Youth B stated he and
Youth A, Youth C and Youth D felt comfortable using profanity
around Staff 1 after she shared her dating story. Youth B stated
Youth A was upset and surprised when he learned Staff 1 did not
give them merit points for using profanity. Youth B stated Youth A
then wrote a grievance about Staff 1 sharing her dating story.
Youth B stated Staff 1 learned of the grievance and came to Unit
2D. Youth B stated he heard Staff 1 say, “… stay in the circle …
we not gang anymore” to Youth A, which meant Staff 1 did not
want her dating story shared, and Youth A and Staff 1 were no
longer amicable.
Youth C was interviewed on 11/27/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with DHHS worker 1. Youth C stated Youth A
wrote a grievance about Staff 1 sharing her dating story. Youth C
stated Staff 1 came to Unit 2D on 11/25/2024 and tried to talk
Youth A out of writing a grievance. Youth C stated he heard Staff
1 say, “We can work this out”.
Youth D was interviewed on 12/05/2024 at Wayne County
Juvenile Detention with DHHS worker 2. Youth D stated Youth A
saw a piece of paper on the staff desk that showed Staff 1
dropped his merit points for inappropriate language. Youth D
5

stated Youth A felt it was a double standard that he could not use
profanity, but Staff 1 could share her dating story. Youth D stated
Youth A wrote a grievance about Staff 1’s story.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 12/05/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with another DHHS worker 2. Staff 1 stated she holds
the youths accountable. Staff 1 provided the examples of youth
using profanity and not staying in their assigned area as times she
would award a youth with zero merit points. Staff 1 stated she
spoke with Youth A when she learned he was upset and writing a
grievance. Staff 1 stated she did not try to dissuade him from
writing a grievance but wanted Youth A to understand why she
shared the story. Staff 1 stated Youth A did not acknowledge
being upset with her.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 12/05/2024 at Wayne County Juvenile
Detention with DHHS worker 2. Staff 2 stated Youth A and Youth
B talked about writing a grievance on Staff 1 when they learned
Staff 1 gave them zero merit points for using profanity. Staff 2
stated youths learn of their merit point score once a week during
their time to exchange merit points for rewards. Staff 2 stated she
did not know how Youth A and Youth B determined that Staff 1
gave them zero merit points as the merit points binder is kept in a
locked cabinet.
Manager stated on 12/05/2024 that Staff 1 has not been
scheduled to work since Youth A wrote a grievance on 11/21/2024
about Staff 1.
Documentation
Youth A wrote a grievance dated 11/21/2024. It states Staff 1
talked to Unit 2D youths about inappropriate things on 11/19/2024.
Analysis The agency is found in noncompliance because Staff 1 admits to
talking with Youth A about his grievance. This compromises the
integrity of the grievance process.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED

As a result of the findings in this investigation, a corrective action plan is required.
